Job Description: If you are detail-oriented and tech-savvy, find satisfaction in digital organization, and love immersing yourself in finding new and interesting vacation rentals, this role is for you!

Although this is a temporary position, at 40 hours per week, there is strong potential for full-time employment.

Location: Atlanta, GA

Duration: Temporary with Potential for Full-Time Hire

Responsibilities:

Data Cleaning and Enhancement

  • Review and analyze existing HubSpot data to identify inaccuracies, inconsistencies, and duplicates.

  • Enhance HubSpot records with additional relevant information, such as property details, rental volume, and existing coverage solutions.
  • Utilize data cleansing tools and techniques to optimize the HubSpot database.

Market Research

  • Conduct thorough market research to identify key players and emerging trends within the vacation rental property management industry.
  • Identify and profile potential target customers who align with our ideal client profile.
  • Assist in identifying key information about target buyers & current customers that yields faster close rates and increases confidence among our buyers.
  • Work cross-functionally with sales, marketing, partnerships, and customer success to improve key info used to prospect, qualify, and close business.

Qualifications:

  • Previous experience in market research, data analysis, or CRM management preferred.
  • Proficiency in CRM software (e.g., Salesforce, HubSpot) preferred.
  • Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex data sets and draw actionable insights.
  • Excellent attention to detail and organizational skills.
  • Effective communication and collaboration abilities.
  • Self-motivated with the ability to work independently and meet deadlines.

Benefits:

  • Competitive compensation package.
  • Opportunity for full-time employment based on performance and business needs.
  • Exposure to a fast-growing and innovative industry.
  • Opportunities for career growth and advancement within a rapidly expanding company.
  • Ongoing training and support to help you succeed in your role.
  • Fun and collaborative work environment with a focus on innovation and teamwork.

If you are passionate about market research, data analysis, and driving business growth, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity to contribute to our team's success. Please submit your resume and cover letter detailing your relevant experience and why you are interested in joining Safely. We look forward to hearing from you!

About The Role

Are you someone who is excited at the prospect of working for dynamic, leading audio brands that deliver world-class experiences in the home, on-the-go, and in some of the world’s most amazing venues? Are you upbeat and inquisitive about human behavior? Are you a critical thinker who thrives on building a better way to do things? Then working on HARMAN audio brands (JBL, Harman Kardon, and AKG, to name a few) may be right for you.

We are at a critical time in the insights industry, with so much “data” at our fingertips. And it’s imperative that we sift through the noise to uncover the true insights that will drive our business forward. We at HARMAN have been making the investment to understand our brands across the world to accelerate our cultural relevance and growth.

As the Insights Senior Researcher, you will analyze and interpret brand and business data to make the Marketing organization smarter about the programs we develop and investments we make, all in service of increasing our competitiveness.

We are looking for a talented consumer insights researcher that has a passion working with data to find the insights needed to drive strategic decision making.

What You Will Do

Partner with marketing teams and regional stakeholders around the world to execute research studies, build effective analysis tools, measurement plans, goals, and KPI scorecards to measure our marketing efforts. Manage several external agencies on primary and secondary research studies from setup through launch, fielding and reporting. Construct and Maintain large data sets and dashboards including data interpretation and identifying key insightsHealth of our brands, through Social Listening and traditional Brand Equity studies. Campaign performance, through brand lift studies, social media metrics and media spend analysis. Health of our business, through Market Data Analytics. Control 3 global trackers across 15 countries for brand, category and social media to ensure flawless execution, standardization and effective analysis. Prepare and present research studies to regional and global marketing colleagues conveying key insights and jobs to be done. Liaise with colleagues across global Marketing, Corporate Strategy, Product category leaders and Finance for data collection to uncover insights and present findings. Prepare quality checks and data verification to ensure accuracy and consistency; identify and solve project issues. Devise and evaluate methods to improve the data collection process, such as digital automation and dashboards. 

What You Need

Bachelor's degree in Market Research, Statistics, 5+ years of experience with proven success. Sociology, Marketing/Business or related field (masters degree preferred). Primary and secondary research experience (both quantitative and qualitative) with the ability to manage studies from design phase to reporting phase. Comfortable using research and database tools such as Qualtrics, Power BI, Qlik Sense, NPD Decision Key, social media listening platforms and other data mining platforms. Mastery in data manipulation and ability to interpret large amounts of data and simplify complex ideas. Extensive experience in Microsoft Office software required, including high proficiency in Excel and PowerPoint. Ability to advise on data strategy and governance by connecting the dots to accommodate all of marketing’ needs. Experience working in a highly matrix organization and across different regions, ideally in a global role. 

What Is Nice To Have

Strong analytical and mathematical reasoning and problem-solvingLarge brand and/or major retail client experience. Experience at a data vendor and/or market research agency (i.e. Nielsen, IRI, NPD, etc.). 

What Makes You Eligible

Be willing to travel up to 10%, domestic and international travel. This role is eligible to work remotely with weekly trips into the Stamford, CT office as scheduled or requested (this could be on 24-hour notice). Successfully complete a background investigation and drug screen as a condition of employment

Title: Lead Marketing Analyst
Description:
About Quizlet

Inspired by our belief that anyone can learn anything and powered by our own curiosity, we build the smartest tools we can imagine to help students learn.

Quizlet is the popular, global learning platform and app that millions of students, teachers and everyday people use to study any subject imaginable for school, work or as part of their personal interests -- including two-thirds of high school students and half of all college students in the US. Combining cognitive science and machine learning, Quizlet guides students through adaptive study activities to confidently reach their learning goals. We’re on track to become the undisputed leader in user-generated learning content and engagement, at the scale of YouTube.

Valued at $1 billion, Quizlet has raised over $60 million in venture capital from investors including Icon Ventures, Union Square Ventures, General Atlantic, Costanoa Ventures, Owl Ventures, and Altos Ventures.

To serve our global community of learners, our teams tackle lofty technical challenges and design for use cases across cultures and languages. We work hard, act like owners, and collaborate every chance we get. We’re energized by the potential to power more learners through multiple approaches and various tools.

About The Team

Quizlet’s marketing team plays a pivotal role in comprehending and effectively conveying Quizlet’s value proposition to students and teachers, with the ultimate goal of elevating brand awareness, fostering user engagement, and driving growth in subscriptions and ads revenue.

About The Role

Reporting directly into the head of marketing, the Lead Marketing Analyst will serve as a highly cross-functional partner. You will work closely with members across the marketing organization to help them understand the incremental impact they are driving to Quizlet. You will also be responsible for collaborating with our Data Science team to ensure our efforts are aligned and tracking with extended team and company objectives.

This is a hybrid role based out of our New York or San Francisco offices.

In This Role, You Will

Measure the impact and effectiveness of various marketing strategies (across direct response, lifecycle, product and brand marketing) against predetermined team and company goals and use the data to inform future goalsPartner with the product marketing and lifecycle teams to chart the student journey, illuminating points of higher engagement and drop off to better understand and inform onsite and lifecycle communication opportunitiesBe a key owner with Data Engineering in our investment in new marketing analytics reporting tools in 2024 and beyondMeet with Data Scientists across the company to understand changes in reporting in the data, be it tables, definitions, compelling A/B results, models to try, etcSupport clearer attribution efforts and strategies for key marketing initiativesSupport our external communications efforts through data storytelling, identifying compelling trends and topics that will generate interest across media

Own The Creation Of Dashboards To Help

Measure user growth, subscription and revenue impact and assign value across all marketing channelsMeasure the performance and engagement across social media channels to help inform strategy and understand campaign performanceMeasure and monitor brand sentiment across social media channels

What You Bring To The Table

8+ years of experience in marketing analytics 6+ years of experience running marketing analytics for paid and social campaignsMust have advanced SQL skills using window functions and CTEs, including highly developed QA skills and ability to write efficient, optimized code 6+ years of practical knowledge running incremental testsfor marketing teams

Bonus Points If You Have

Experience working with Periscope and BigQuery

Compensation, Benefits & Perks

Quizlet is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Salary transparency helps to mitigate unfair hiring practices when it comes to discrimination and pay gaps. Total compensation for this role is market competitive, including a starting base salary of $170,000 - $200,000, depending on location and experience, as well as company stock optionsCollaborate with your manager and team to create a healthy work-life balance20 vacation days (and we expect you to take them!)Competitive health, dental, and vision insurance (100% employee and 75% dependent PPO, HMO, VSP Choice)Employer-sponsored 401k plan with company matchAccess to LinkedIn Learning and other resources to support professional growthPaid Family Leave, FSA, HSA, Commuter benefits, Wellness benefits40 hours of annual paid time off to participate in volunteer programs of choice

We strive to make everyone feel comfortable and welcome! 

We work to create a holistic interview process, where both Quizlet and candidates have an opportunity to view what it would be like to work together, in exploring a mutually beneficial partnership.

We provide a transparent setting, that gives a comprehensive view of who we are!

In Closing

We hope you are excited about everything you read so far. We highly encourage you to apply for this position, even if you feel you do not meet all the requirements. Quizlet is always looking for amazing folks that believe in our mission and can contribute to our team in various ways - not merely candidates that fit a certain mold.

We have a bias for action, take initiative, and take pride in delivering results. We make informed decisions whenever possible but are unafraid to take calculated risks on great ideas to promote learning. We embrace challenges and see effort as the path to mastery. We’re constantly seeking opportunities to learn and we embrace curiosity. Quality matters at Quizlet, and we hold the bar high on everything we do.

We treat each other with honesty and respect, encourage vigorous debate, and seek critical feedback. We value diversity, humility, transparency, and collaboration as the best paths to our success — as individuals, as a team, and as a company.

Quizlet’s success as an online learning community depends on a strong commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion. We are actively working to build a team that is representative of the diverse communities we serve, and an open, inclusive work environment where all employees can thrive. As an equal opportunity employer and a tech company committed to societal change, we welcome applicants from all backgrounds. Women, people of color, members of the LGBTQ+ community, individuals with disabilities, and veterans are strongly encouraged to apply. Come join us!

To All Recruiters And Placement Agencies

At this time Quizlet does not accept unsolicited agency resumes and/or profiles.

Please do not forward unsolicited agency resumes to our website or to any Quizlet employee. Quizlet will not pay fees to any third-party agency or firm nor will it be responsible for any agency fees associated with unsolicited resumes. All unsolicited resumes received will be considered the property of Quizlet.
